intro: Dodecatheon tetrandrum, commonly known as the four-threaded globemallow, is a herbaceous perennial native to the United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Dodecatheon tetrandrum thrives in woodland or open areas and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
